1. Weigh out 120 g of Pr, 192 g of Si, 12 g of Tm, and 88 g of Y. 2. In a clean mixing bowl, combine all the powdered ingredients thoroughly using a spatula until uniform. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to grind the mixture further for 10 minutes to ensure homogeneity.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out 120 g of Pr, 192 g of Si, 12 g of Tm, and 88 g of Y. 2. In a clean mixing bowl, combine all the powdered ingredients thoroughly using a spatula until uniform. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to grind the mixture further for 10 minutes to ensure homogeneity.

steps: 1. Preheat a furnace to 1200°C. 2. Transfer the mixed powders into a crucible suitable for high temperatures. 3. Place the crucible in the furnace and heat for 4 hours to facilitate chemical bonding.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a furnace to 1200°C. 2. Transfer the mixed powders into a crucible suitable for high temperatures. 3. Place the crucible in the furnace and heat for 4 hours to facilitate chemical bonding.

steps: 1. After 4 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down to room temperature naturally (approximately 6-8 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace door until it has completely cooled to avoid thermal shock.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After 4 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down to room temperature naturally (approximately 6-8 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace door until it has completely cooled to avoid thermal shock.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the crucible and take out the solidified material. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the material into the desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 3. Sand the edges using fine-grit sandpaper to achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a sealant suitable for the material to enhance durability.
